## isNumber() function

Checks if value is classified as a Number primitive or object. Note: To exclude Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN, which are classified as numbers, use the \_.isFinite method.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function isNumber(value: any, allowNaN?: boolean): value is number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  value | <code>any</code> |  |
|  allowNaN | <code>boolean</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`value is number`

â€” Returns true if value is correctly classified, else false.
